li.a: General Admission to All Athletic Events
What do these people have in common?
Accident Insurance Enrollment Packet for Students 2019-20

img.alt: Senior Spotlight David A Hicks III

strong.span:
PSD Virtual and
Alternative
Learning Academies

div.span: COVID19 has presented us with many challenges to overcome. It has also put a bright light on how the lack of resources caused by the state's failure to use the fair funding formula puts Pottstown children at disadvantage to receive educational opportunities for success. Thanks to a very generous anonymous donation to the Foundation For Pottstown Education for supporting remote learning opportunities for students. Read Evan Brandt's Digital Notebook Blog for the story.

It is with great Pride that we announce for the 2nd year in a row. A Pottstown Trojan Female Basketball Player has been selected by the Pottstown Chapter of PIAA Basketball Officials for the Yogi Strom Sportsmanship Scholarship. Congratulations to Senior Captain Kawanza Hodge.Next year Kawanza will be attending St.Joseph University with a major in Bio Chemistry and hopes to become a surgeon. Trojan Proud of our student athletes, who are outstanding ambassadors of our school and community.Thank you for giving us another reason to say Proud to be from Pottstown.

When it comes to caring about his community and wanting to help make a difference in the battle against COVID 19, Pottstown High School Senior Darren Groff 's efforts can not be masked. Darren has made 40 lined face masks and donated them to Children and Youth employees. Share the news. Another reason to say Proud to be from Pottstown.

Proud of our student athletes who are ambassadors of our community both on and off the playing field. Their achievements in athletics and academics gives us another reason to say Proud to be from Pottstown.
Yes we all need to stay home right now BUT that will not stop Pottstown School District from providing students with valuable information to assist in career pathway selection.

div.span: This video from some of our students has a lot of Pottstown teachers smiling right now. CLICK HERE TO SEE VIDEO.

img.title: Troiad yearbooks
img.alt: PHS Yearbook needs your pictures and stories

div.span: PHS Yearbook advisor Mrs.Yoder needs your help ASAP. Due to school closure and cancellation of student activities there are many pages that need to be filled in this year's book. Great opportunity for you to be part of the staff. Please send her pictures and stories of activities, accomplishments, future plans, coping COVID19. Use your imagination ( so long as you are school appropriate) Email to [email protected] Deadline for submission is April 17th.

strong.span: Lincoln staff welcome student home, from afar, after final chemo treatment

div.p: POTTSTOWN — It's scary enough having kidney cancer and getting chemotherapy in the third grade. Having that happen in the middle of a worldwide pandemic can't make it better. The best thing in such a situation, no doubt, is a strong support network at home. Luckily for Joseph Pollock, he lives in Pottstown and attends Lincoln Elementary School.

Joseph has been fighting cancer since the beginning of the school year, long before coronavirus upended everything we once considered normal. With school closed and friends sequestered as part of the state-wide stay-at-home guidance, Joseph's homecoming after his final treatment stood to be a somewhat solitary affair, with his mom, dad and sister.
Instead, when they turned onto North Hanover Street on April 1, there was a parade in his honor, and it was no April Fool's joke.

Recognizing the need to keep their distance, particularly given that chemotherapy patients are often immunocompromised, staff from Lincoln gathered along the street to cheer Joseph's return from afar. They cheered, held up signs and balloons and made a general ruckus in Joseph's honor.

img.title: Word Eggs
img.alt: The Egg Man Helps To Teach Sounds

div.span: The Egg Man AKA Rupert principal Mr. Matt Moyer has a great fun activity to help young ones learn their sounds and words while we are all home due to the school closure. CLICK HERE TO VIEW VIDEO
PHS Chromebook pick up and repair for high school students is tomorrow, 4/8. Please check your email for pick up time.

Dear 7th Graders - You are invited to apply to be a member of our middle school WEB Leaders! WEB Leaders are good role models for younger students who have been successful at Pottstown Middle School. You could be a tremendous influence on our younger students and you will learn many valuable leadership skills in the process. Plus, it will be fun!

img.title: Danielle Mccoy and LaTanya White
img.alt: PHS Grads Show Their Trojan Pride

div.span: Trojan Proud of two of our PHS grads who are helping to keep Pottstown strong. Danielle McCoy,Principal Of Pottstown High School and LaTanya White, Director of Students Services are two homegrown ladies that continue to show their care and love for students during these challenging times.They have organized the collection and distribution of thousands of pounds of food to needy families.Each Sunday 180 students receive a food package to insure they will have meals for the upcoming week. In ture Pottstown fashion they are hands on boots on the ground leaders by example, as they help their group of teachers and support staff volunteers pack and hand deliver packages to families. They and all of the volunteers give us another reason to say Proud to be from Pottstown. Help share the news.

img.title: inEQUITY
img.alt: Tell Harrisburg Give Pottstown Kids a Chance

div.span: The coronavirus pandemic has thrown a virus-sized monkey wrench into public school operations. With a state-wide school closure order, educators are left with little choice but to turn to the Internet to teach their students. CLICK HERE TO READ THE ENTIRE STORY.
